intro.description: This CheatSheet is a tutotial for using the Javscript Console in Bioclipse.

item.title: Step 1: Reveal the JavaScript Console
item.description: If not visible, reveal the JavaScript Console from the menu Window > Show View > Other... and then under category Scripting, select JavaScript Console.

item.title: Step 2: Explore tab completion
item.description:
The JavaScript Console is equipped with tab completion. Simply press the tab key to reveal the core namespaces that are available.
A namespace is a grouping of functionality; for example, the cdk namespace groups CDK functionality. Write 'cdk.' ending with a dot, and press the tab key again. Now you will see the methods the cdk namespace offers.

item.title: Step 3: Getting help for commands
item.description:
In the JavaScript Console, write 'help'. This shows the same list of namespaces as pressing the tab key.
Try 'help cdk'. This displays help about all methods in cdk, and what inputs they expect.
Try 'help cdk.fromSMILES'. This shows an explanation for what this method does.

item.title: Step 4: Some basic commands
item.description:
Try the following commands, they are quite self-explanatory:
js.say("hello world " + (12-4))
clear()

item.title: Step 5: Opening files in editors
item.description:
The 'ui' namespace contains methods to interact with editors. Try the following:
mol=cdk.fromSMILES("CC")
mol2=cdk.generate2dCoordinates(mol)
cdk.saveMolecule(mol2, "/Virtual/mymol.cml")
Note in the Bioclipse Navigator that this file is created. Now write: 'ui.open(' and then drag this file and drop it onto the JavaScript Console. This completes the command too look like:
ui.open("/Virtual/mymol.cml")
This opens the molecule (now with 2D coordinates) in JChemPaint.
